item.title: Report X-2025051776
item.description:
Report X-2025051776

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: FORT WAYNE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO (2) PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 2 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PET FOOD. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1ZG415331317985600. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACAKGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER G41533, SNUGGLEME, 6824 MOHAWK DR, FORT WAYNE IN 46825-3964.

item.title: Report E-2025050291
item.description:
Report E-2025050291

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from two (2) 1-gallon poly jugs due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the jugs being damaged by other freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050288
item.description:
Report E-2025050288

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The damaged container was placed into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050966
item.description:
Report X-2025050966

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be smoking. Once the DG agent arrvied it was discovered that the package had been turned inside out so that none of the DG markings could be seen by FedEx. The corrosive material that leaked also ate away at the box. Does not seem to have any packaging material to absorb if the bottle had leaked. The DG agent also looked up the SDS to confirm that the contents were DG. Package is being held.

item.title: Report X-2025051214
item.description:
Report X-2025051214

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be emitting smoke from a reaction of the chemical inside the package. Once the package was contained and inspected it was discoved that the package actually contained a DG. Also it was discovered that there was also a second spill from the same shipper with same inner contents. Packages are being held.

item.title: Report E-2025060011
item.description:
Report E-2025060011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum along with a damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050173
item.description:
Report E-2025050173

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: while unloading drums it was noticed that one drum had a loose ring. Upon further inspection it was found that the open-head drum was missing a gasket and that was why the ring was loose. Around 1/2 of gallon of material leaked out. All material was contained and nothing was released offsite. Inhouse cleanup methods were used.

item.title: Report E-2025050010
item.description:
Report E-2025050010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty (20) pounds of material released from one (1) 500-pound plastic bag due to a forklift accident that resulted in the bag being punctured. The released material impacted the concrete floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Gloves and other absorbents, that didn't match what Superior uses, were discovered between the drum and pallet. The leaking drum was placed in an overpack and the leaked material was cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2025050279
item.description:
Report E-2025050279

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail in a box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 10-gallon ploy drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The damaged container was containerized in one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
